1.name: Citizen Kane
1.description: Following the death of publishing tycoon, Charles Foster Kane, reporters scramble to uncover the meaning of his final utterance; 'Rosebud'.

2.name: The Lady Eve
2.description: A trio of classy card sharks targets the socially awkward heir to brewery millions for his money, until one of them falls in love with him.

3.name: The Maltese Falcon
3.description: A private detective takes on a case that involves him with three eccentric criminals, a gorgeous liar, and their quest for a priceless statuette.

4.name: The Wolf Man
4.description: A practical man returns to his homeland, is attacked by a creature of folklore, and infected with a horrific disease his disciplined mind tells him can not possibly exist.

5.name: Dumbo
5.description: Ridiculed because of his enormous ears, a young circus elephant is assisted by a mouse to achieve his full potential.

6.name: Blossoms in the Dust
6.description: After losing her young son, Edna Gladney opposes the unfair laws discriminating against children whose parents are unknown, and opens an orphanage for those children.

7.name: I Wake Up Screaming
7.description: Why is Inspector Ed Cornell trying to railroad Frankie Christopher for the murder of model Vicky Lynn?

8.name: Suspicion
8.description: A shy young heiress marries a charming gentleman, and soon begins to suspect he is planning to murder her.

9.name: Sergeant York
9.description: A marksman is drafted in World War I and ends up becoming one of the most celebrated war heroes.

10.name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
10.description: Dr. Jekyll allows his dark side to run wild when he drinks a potion that turns him into the evil Mr. Hyde.

11.name: Sullivan's Travels
11.description: A director of escapist films goes on the road as a hobo to learn about life, which gives him a rude awakening.

12.name: How Green Was My Valley
12.description: At the turn of the century in a Welsh mining village, the Morgans, he stern, she gentle, raise coal-mining sons and hope their youngest will find a better life.

13.name: The Shepherd of the Hills
13.description: A mysterious stranger arrives in the Missouri hills and befriends a young backwoods girl. Much to the dislike of her moonshiner fiancé who has vowed to find and kill his own father.

14.name: High Sierra
14.description: After being released from prison, notorious thief Roy Earle is hired by his old boss to help a group of inexperienced criminals plan and carry out the robbery of a California resort.

15.name: Adventures of Captain Marvel
15.description: To protect a magic talisman from being used for evil, a teenage boy named Billy Batson is given the power to become an adult superhero, Captain Marvel, with a single magic word: "Shazam!"

16.name: Ziegfeld Girl
16.description: Discovery by Flo Ziegfeld changes a girl's life but not necessarily for the better, as three beautiful women find out when they join the spectacle on Broadway: Susan, the singer who must ...                See full summary »

17.name: Penny Serenade
17.description: A couple's big dreams give way to a life full of unexpected sadness and unexpected joy.

18.name: Meet John Doe
18.description: A man needing money agrees to impersonate a nonexistent person who said he'd be committing suicide as a protest, and a political movement begins.

19.name: Ball of Fire
19.description: A group of professors working on a new encyclopedia encounter a mouthy nightclub singer who is wanted by the police to help bring down her mob boss lover.

20.name: That Hamilton Woman
20.description: The story of courtesan and dance-hall girl Emma Hamilton, including her relationships with Sir William Hamilton and Admiral Horatio Nelson and her rise and fall, set during the Napoleonic Wars.

21.name: The Strawberry Blonde
21.description: Quick-tempered yet likable Biff Grimes falls for the beautiful Virginia Brush, but he is not the only young man in the neighborhood who is smitten with her.

22.name: The Little Foxes
22.description: The ruthless, moneyed Hubbard clan lives in, and poisons, their part of the deep South at the turn of the twentieth century.

23.name: Topper Returns
23.description: A fun-loving young woman is murdered after trading bedrooms with her wealthy friend. Her ghost seeks aid from Topper to find the murderer.

24.name: Mr. & Mrs. Smith
24.description: A couple who have been married for three years are shocked to learn that their marriage is not legally valid.

25.name: I Thank You
25.description: Struggling entertainers who are trying to put on a show pose as servants to wealthy woman in hopes of raising the money.

26.name: Hold That Ghost
26.description: After inheriting a fortune from a gangster, two dim-witted service station attendants find themselves stranded in a haunted house.

27.name: 49th Parallel
27.description: A World War II U-boat crew are stranded in northern Canada. To avoid internment, they must make their way to the border and get into the still-neutral U.S.

28.name: Tobacco Road
28.description: Hillbilly family life in 1941 rural Georgia.

29.name: The Reluctant Dragon
29.description: Humorist Robert Benchley learns about the animation process at Walt Disney Studios while trying to find the great man himself to pitch him the idea of making a cartoon about a shy dragon.

30.name: The Shanghai Gesture
30.description: In Shanghai, dragon-lady 'Mother' Gin Sling operates a gambling house for wealthy patrons but she clashes with influential land developer Sir Guy Charteris who wants to put her out-of-business.

31.name: All That Money Can Buy
31.description: A nineteenth-century New Hampshire farmer who makes a pact with Satan for economic success enlists Daniel Webster to extract him from his contract.

32.name: Sun Valley Serenade
32.description: When Phil Corey's band arrives at the Idaho ski resort its pianist Ted Scott is smitten with a Norwegian refugee he has sponsored, Karen Benson. When soloist Vivian Dawn quits, Karen stages an ice show as a substitute.

33.name: Here Comes Mr. Jordan
33.description: Boxer Joe Pendleton dies 50 years too soon due to a heavenly mistake, and is given a new life as a millionaire playboy.

34.name: In Old Colorado
34.description: Joe Weiler has instigated a conflict over water rights between two ranchers. The idea is to have the ranchers do each other in then move in and take over. Hoppy and the good guys won't let this happen.

35.name: Genroku Chûshingura
35.description: In 1701, Lord Takuminokami Asano has a feud with Lord Kira and he tries to kill Kira in the corridors of the Shogun's palace. The Shogun sentences Lord Asano to commit suppuku and deprives ...                See full summary »

36.name: The Black Cat
36.description: Elderly Henrietta Winslow lives in an isolated mansion with her housekeeper and beloved cats. As her health fails, her greedy relatives gather in anticipation of her death.

37.name: Spooks Run Wild
37.description: The boys are sent to a mountain camp. Stranded in a small rural town, they hear about a "monster killer" roaming the countryside. At night, they sneak out. Peewee is shot by a grave-digger,...                See full summary »

38.name: Hold Back the Dawn
38.description: Stopped in Mexico by U.S. Immigration, Georges Iscovescu hopes to get into the country by marrying a citizen.

39.name: Babes on Broadway
39.description: Tommy Williams desperately wants to get to Broadway, but as he is only singing in a spaghetti house for tips he is a long way off. He meets Penny Morris, herself no mean singer, and through...                See full summary »

40.name: Shadow of the Thin Man
40.description: Nick and Nora are at their wisecracking best as they investigate murder and racketeering at a local race track.

41.name: Texas
41.description: Two young men head west in search of fortune and adventure.

42.name: Pot o' Gold
42.description: Jimmy, the owner of a failed music shop, goes to work with his uncle, the owner of a food factory. Before he gets there, he befriends an Irish family who happens to be his uncle's worst ...                See full summary »

43.name: The Devil and Miss Jones
43.description: A tycoon goes undercover to ferret out agitators at a department store, but gets involved in their lives instead.

44.name: Man Hunt
44.description: British hunter Thorndike vacationing in Bavaria has Hitler in his gun sight. He is captured, beaten, left for dead, and escapes back to London where he is hounded by German agents and aided by a young woman.

45.name: The Great Lie
45.description: After a newlywed's husband apparently dies in a plane crash, she discovers that her rival for his affections is now pregnant with his child.

46.name: Belle Starr
46.description: At the end of the Civil War, an embittered Southern belle joins forces with a Confederate guerrilla leader to raid Union towns.

47.name: Hellzapoppin'
47.description: Olsen and Johnson, a pair of stage comedians, try to turn their play into a movie and bring together a young couple in love, while breaking the fourth wall every step of the way.

48.name: Jungle Girl
48.description: Dr. John Meredith has been driven from civilization by the criminal activities of his twin brother Bradley Meredith. With his infant daughter, he settles in the African jungle, where his ...                See full summary »

49.name: The Sea Wolf
49.description: After being fished out of the sea by a sealer, three fugitives find themselves prisoners of the ship's brutal skipper who refuses to put them ashore and they hatch an escape plan during a crew mutiny.

50.name: Buck Privates
50.description: Two sidewalk salesman enlist in the army in order to avoid jail, only to find that their drill instructor is the police officer who tried having them imprisoned.
